title: What Surging Gas Prices Mean for You
sub_head: ‘I can’t afford to drive Uber anymore’: People are reconsidering driving and spending habits and their employment amid record prices
body:
Americans are rethinking their driving and spending habits as gasoline prices surge to record highs.
The average price of regular unleaded gasoline in the U.S. reached $4.252 a gallon Wednesday, according to AAA, after earlier this week breaking the previous record from July 2008. In California, the average price hit $5.573 a gallon, which is also a record.
